The third warmest February is based on taking temperatures with a mercury thermometer invented in 1714. The Earth has warmed up and cooled down in the past when humans weren‚Äôt around yet.

If it‚Äôs not CO2 causing global warming, what is it? We know that Earth's climate has warmed and cooled many times in the past. How did this happen. Greenhouse gases play no role in the warming of the planet. It is warmed because more solar radiation is absorbed because of decreasing cloud cover. The change is slight but there is no doubt that there is enough variation in cloud cover to effect the amount of sunlight reflected back to space by 1.2 C or more. See paper here... climate-veritas.com/?page_id‚Ä¶ According to this research paper, the answer is simple. For a variety of reasons, the cloud cover of the earth changes regularly. As cloud cover decreases, less sunlight is reflected into space and the earth warms a bit more rapidly. The reverse is true when cloud cover increases. One speculation as to what impacts the amount of cloud cover is based on changes in the earth‚Äôs magnetic field. Why it happens needs more research. But the fact that it happens is now irrefutable because cloud cover has been measured by NASA since 2001 via a satellite-based system called CERES.  CERES allows us to know how cloud cover is changing and how that relates to the amount of solar radiation that is striking the Earth surface. The correlation between decreasing cloud cover and the earth surface temp. is irrefutable.  This is all documented and well explained in a paper produced by Ned Nikolov Ph.D and Karl Zeller Ph.D.  climate-veritas.com/?page_id‚Ä¶

If its not CO2 causing global warming what is?    We know that earth's climate has warmed and cooled many times in the past.  How did this happen.    See paper here...   Green house gases play no role in the warming of the planet.¬† It is warmed because more solar radiation is absorbed because of decreasing cloud cover.    climate-veritas.com/?page_id‚Ä¶  According to recent research paper, the answer is simple. For a variety of reasons, the cloud cover of the earth changes regularly.  As cloud cover decreases, there less sunlight is reflected back into space and the earth warms.  The reverse is true when cloud cover increases.  When considering this, realize that the change in temp. we are currently worrying about (3C) is less than 4% of the total atmospheric temp - the moon surface temp difference is 89degC less than the earth with no atmosphere and the same amount of sunlight.  So the temp. change when viewed on the grand impersonal scale of the relationship between sun and earth is really not very dramatic.   The authors of a study paper have concluded that what happens is that global cloud cover is constantly changing.  This results in more or less solar heat reaching the surface of the earth and it has nothing at all to do with CO2.  It does however have a lot to do with water vapor.    In simple terms, they conclude the following,  "Green house gases play no role in the warming of the planet.¬† It is warmed because more solar radiation is absorbed because of decreasing cloud cover."  Case closed.. the science is now settled.. maybe.  LOL  See summary article here.   climate-veritas.com/?page_id‚Ä¶
